intro: Tricalysia dundusanensis, commonly known as the Dundusana tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain edible seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
